snippet: Oscar Hernandez, the former mayor of Bell, was also ordered to pay $241,000 in restitution to the city, which was driven close to bankruptcy by a scheme to vastly inflate official salaries.
abstract: Oscar Hernandez, former mayor of Bell, Calif, is sentenced to one year in jail and five years probation for his part in inflated salary scandal that nearly bankrupted the city; is also ordered to pay $241,000 in restitution to city.
lead_paragraph: Oscar Hernandez, the former mayor of Bell, was also ordered to pay $241,000 in restitution to the city, which was driven close to bankruptcy by a scheme to vastly inflate official salaries.

headline.main: Ex-Mayor of Scandal-Ridden Town in California Gets One Year in Jail
headline.print_headline: Ex-Mayor of Scandal-Ridden Town in California Gets One Year in Jail
